attributes.action: Ban the use of glyphosate in the UK
attributes.background:
Since classified a probable carcinogen, many are saying NO to glyphosate.

Why not prove chemicals safe before allowing use? 

UK GOV If you take your duty of care seriously, you would ban it now, pending review, as there is no proof it does not cause illnesses & mounting evidence it does.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is on behalf of ‘Against Glyphosate Europe’ - A networking, solidarity and information exchange group for European based campaigners wanting to effect Glyphosate bans. (Can be found on facebook)

Reasons to ban: 

1)	Dewayne Johnson against Monsanto - www.theguardian.com/business/2018/aug/11/one-mans-suffering-exposed-monsantos-secrets-to-the-world

2)	WHO: ‘probably carcinogenic’ 

3)	Glyphosate can cause cancer: www.euronews.com/2016/07/01/glyphosate-can-cause-cancer

4) Many countries banning it

Too many more to list - do your research

attributes.action: Issue an RAF centenary medal to all serving RAF personnel.
attributes.background: The RAF celebrates its centenary year in 2018 and given its illustrious past and its continued contribution to the safety and security of the United Kingdom, a centenary medal should be issued to all serving members of the RAF who achieve permanent service within the Royal Air Force during 2018.

attributes.action: Mandatory minimum sentence for shaken baby deaths no guilty plea reduction.
attributes.background: We are calling for a mandatory minimum sentence of 15 years when an offender kills a child through shaking the infant. This should also mean that they are not eligible for the reduction in sentence when pleading guilty to get a lower jail term.
attributes.additional_details: The case of lee sweet who pled guilty to manslaughter of his son should serve as a warning that this should never happen again.  No family should have to wait a year to lay to rest such a precious life, let alone have to watch as he received a third reduction in sentence for pleading guilty after 11 months of denining it.

attributes.action: FA2017 Part 2 Clause 29(2) to include calorific maltodextrin
attributes.background: Calorific maltodextrin has high GI but not included as sugars. Consumers are misled as to amount of sugars in drinks where glycemic maltodextrin not included.  Sugar drinks levy should take account of all glycemic carbohydrates

attributes.action: Stop plans to cut Cannon Street trains on the Hayes (Kent) train line
attributes.background: Following a government consultation on the future of south eastern rail services, the secretary for State for Transport is recommending that companies bidding for the south eastern train franchise should make their bid based on the proposed change to cut services to Cannon Street from 2022.
attributes.additional_details: The Hayes line would in future run to London Bridge, Charing Cross and Victoria. The paper states that the ‘ small number of passengers who currently travel to Cannon Street, would need to change at London Bridge’.  The trains to Cannon Street are already extremely busy with no seats available by the time the trains reach Catford. Cutting the services would have a huge impact on local commuters, not only increasing their travel time but also further overcrowding at London Bridge.

attributes.action: Stop UK government funding the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."
attributes.background: Major questions have been raised about the actions of the Syrian Civil Defence, AKA the "White Helmets."

attributes.action: Make home to school disabled transport free for young adults aged 16 to 19
attributes.background:
I am a parent of a child with a disability. She begins college in 2019 and has no choice but to travel to one approx. 30 minutes drive away. This is our local SEN college and transport will cost over £900pa. 
I ask to review this legislation to ensure that all children can access a free education.
attributes.additional_details: Disabled home to school transport provided by the local authority is free for children up to age 16 as outlined in current disabled legislation. However after 16 this is no longer the case although it is compulsory for a child to stay in a form of education until they are 18. Many children with disabilities stay until 19+. This begs the question as to why disabled school transport is payable after 16. It isn’t means tested and families on low income/benefits will still have to pay up to £900+pa.

attributes.action: Introduce retaining 5% of price, until remedial work on new homes is completed.
attributes.background: Issues reported in the first two years are the responsibility of the house builder, followed by a further eight years of (structural) NHBC insurance cover.  However, from our experience the rectification of problems are being extended beyond the warranty period and some issues are being refused.
attributes.additional_details: Realistically homes cannot be perfect.  However a timely redress for repairs is now required. Therefore, retaining 5% of the purchase price of the property should prompt builders to rectify concerns without delays. Subsequently, this would allow customers not to feel unhappy and stressed in their new homes.

attributes.action: Commit to a long-term funding plan for health & social care to the year 2035.
attributes.background: We are calling on the government to recognise the rising demand, underfunding and workforce crisis in the NHS and social care sector by committing to a long-term funding plan for health and social care to the year 2035.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is supported by the NHS Confederation.

attributes.action: Stop pets being sold online. Many are by breeders, pup farmers, dog theft gangs.
attributes.background: This would drastically cut down this crime and animals being sourced as bait.   Rescues don’t sell, but charge a fee, in most cases won’t cover the vets bills.  Rescue are full to bursting, due to all these criminals who steal pets etc. I’m a member of many who’ll back me on this.
attributes.additional_details:
A good breeder only has pups if asked, I know one and they are in total agreement on this.   
They have a web page but don’t sell pups on it.  People get their pups,either through the kennel club or word of mouth.
There’s no way of regulating this, it’s a great outlet for those who just see these  animals as objects to make money from.  The only way to help put a stop to it altogether is to make it illegal!! 
Online is mainly how puppy farming, back yard breeders sell the manly sickly pups they breed.
 People’s pets are mainly stolen to either sell online or backyard breed from them.

attributes.action: Fund PTSD recovery centres for ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel
attributes.background:
Thousands of ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel have been diagnosed with Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder and depression.
This trauma causes flashbacks, nightmares, anger and depression - often leading to violence, alcohol and substance abuse, job loss, family breakdown and suicide.
attributes.additional_details: We aim to set up a number of PTSD “Front line” recovery centres around the country offering horticultural and other therapeutic treatments specifically aimed at helping to re-habilitate ex-armed forces and emergency services personnel and help them to come to terms with their illness and move on. We plan to arrange a meeting with members of the government and opposition parties to obtain cross party support for this project and ask for £6 million to help fund its start up.

attributes.action: Motorcyclists to upgrade their CBT licence to ride a 250cc at 18
attributes.background: I believe that in order to decrease the jump in power, from a 125cc at 17 and 18, to 47bhp at 19, there should be an intermediate cc at 18, therefore I propose that at 18, a 125cc rider should be able to take another test, in order to ride a 250cc motorbike.
attributes.additional_details: Most riders jump from a 125cc to a restricted 600cc, which is way too much of a jump. 15bhp to 47bhp is more than enough to knock experienced 125cc riders off, if they're not careful. A smaller jump to 47bhp would increase safety for those who are willing to ride a 250cc at 18

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ride a bike without a helmet.
attributes.background: In a majority of bicyclist deaths, the most serious injuries are to the head, highlighting the importance of wearing a bicycle helmet. 1 Helmet use has been estimated to reduce the odds of head injury by 50 percent, and the odds of head, face, or neck injury by 33 percent
attributes.additional_details:
What kids think on the subject. 
“Yes, it should be made the law because the only reason people don't wear helmets is because they would be made fun of. So if everyone wore one then no-one would be made fun of."

attributes.action: Establish a special unit to tackle the misconduct of public officials.
attributes.background:
Abuse of the public's trust has become normalised: it is simply accepted as the way things are and not treated as the criminal offence that it is.
The police cannot get involved in political decisions and for this reason have proven too cautious over this offence, hence the need for a special unit.
attributes.additional_details:
Taking the nation to war on a lie or rending the nation asunder with a promise that there is no intention of keeping are serious abuses of the public's trust, or at least they appear so to me. 

https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/misconduct-public-office

Too often we hear tales of public officers abusing their powers to line their pockets or conceal their wrongdoings, yet we almost never hear of these things being investigated. This need to stop.

attributes.action: 'Method of Slaughter' to be displayed on fresh/frozen meat and poultry.
attributes.background:
Currently UK law calls for all  fresh frozen meats & poultry to display country of rearing, slaughter, cutting and in some cases if the animal was under 6months old, but not the method of slaughter - 'stunned' or 'unstunned'.
As consumers we should have the right to make a conscientious choice.
attributes.additional_details:
The law states all animals should be stunned with the exception of religious slaughter; Halal and Kosher.
RSPCA's evidence clearly indicates that slaughter without pre-stunning can cause unnecessary suffering.
As consumers we should be able to make a conscientious choice whether to support unstunned slaughter or not, which is not possible without clear package labelling showing 'Method of slaughter'

attributes.action: Eliminate the use of black plastic in food packaging.
attributes.background:
Most recycling plants use optical sorting systems which cannot detect the black plastic against the conveyor belts. This means the packaging ends up as landfill or incinerator waste.
When manufacturers use recyclable plastic trays they should be forced to choose a colour suitable for recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
It is misleading for a manufacturer to label the black plastic as recyclable when our recycling plants cannot detect it. To eliminate its use will make recycling information clearer to the consumer. 
Using a different colour will substantially increase the amount of plastic packaging which can be recycled through our household waste collections.

http://www.wrap.org.uk/content/recyclability-black-plastic-packaging-0

attributes.action: Any parent convicted of a child sexual offence to be stripped of parental rights
attributes.background: As it stands both parents have joint parental rights and responsibilities of their children if born from 2003 whether married or not.
attributes.additional_details: Convicted Paedophiles and sex offenders with children born from 2003 still have legal rights and responsibilities over their children. This needs to change as no parent or guardian should have to fight in a family court to have those right revoked.

attributes.action: To address the demise of High Street Businesses by reducing Business rates.
attributes.background:
My local high street is littered with empty shops and the few remaining businesses face closure in the coming months. This is a result of high business rates and rents.
The Government should either reduce business rates or devolve the setting of rates to local authorities.

attributes.action: Protect 20% PPA time for all teachers.
attributes.background: There is a teacher retention crisis at the moment and rather than address that with realistic aims to stop experienced teachers leaving the profession there are recruitment pushes to get more people to train to likely leave after 4 years.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of teachers would cite work/life balance as one of the biggest push factors, most would put this before salary.

The amount of unpaid overtime working evenings and weekends as standard is not sustainable and I would ask that all MPS teachers have a minimum of 20% protected PPA time.

Marking 13 class sets of books as well as planning excellent fully resourced and differentiated lessons in 126.5 hours a year is not achievable and needs to be addressed.

attributes.action: Change universal credit back to the previous benefit system that worked
attributes.background: Forced off ESA to attend a medical with someone unqualified to be forced onto universal credit which has left myself and many others below the poverty line and homeless!

attributes.action: Pressure the Nicaraguan government to stop the violent repression of protests.
attributes.background: Nicaragua has been rocked by the violent repression of peaceful student protests. The police have met protesters with live ammunition, killing many. The UK government alongside allies can pressure the Nicaraguan government stop the crackdown and facilitate peaceful protests.

attributes.action: Lower the maximum temperature allowed when transporting livestock after Brexit
attributes.background:
EU rules require the ability to keep the temperature under 35°C in the animal compartment, when transporting livestock on journeys over eight hours. 

35°C is inhumane and does not cover shorter journeys. There is also no guarantee of protection for livestock after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
Current EU guidance: 
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/farm-animal-welfare-during-transportation#eu-regulation-on-the-welfare-of-animals-in-transport

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for domesticated cats and dogs to be spayed/neutered.
attributes.background: Not spaying/neutering pets has caused shelters to be full to capacity.,therefore there are many strays and feral animals on the streets, struggling  to survive with little help.

attributes.action: Remove the requirement to pay VAT by churches, specifically on building works.
attributes.background: 20% VAT is payable on extensions and refurbishments by churches (and other bodies) which are being undertaken for local communities, many in deprived areas and the amount taken from any funds raised by the churches makes it, in a lot if instances, difficult to carry out all the work required.
attributes.additional_details: Our church in Denton undertook a refurbishment in 2005 which brought many people & groups into the church & its premises, at a time when councils were closing facilities. Churches help by housing groups that otherwise would have to close, or at least restrict the work that they do. This type of includes working with various health groups, places for the young and old to meet, and much more. We are looking at a £1,000,000 project which incurs £200k in tax, this mean much of it will not be done.

attributes.action: Make substance testing facilities mandatory at music festivals
attributes.background:
To help avoid drug related deaths at music festivals, it is essential that changes are made to how events approach substance use.
 
I propose that it becomes mandatory to offer a safe risk free drug testing facility at music festivals.
attributes.additional_details:
If people have access to drug testing facilities they can be given information about the pills which could change their minds about whether to take the substance. 
 
It is clear that despite taking measures to prevent them accessing illegal substances, young people are still determined to indulge in them. Must we continue to watch people die before we do something to prevent this? 
 
With help from services like The Loop who already operate in the UK with support from law enforcement, events can prevent drug related deaths occurring.

attributes.action: Mandate to install standard microfiber filters in washing machines
attributes.background: Around 700,000 microscopic fibres could be released into waste water during each use of a domestic washing machine.These microfibres act as sponges to toxic chemicals known to cause cancer etc. They end up in Fish/ Sea Salt/Tap&Bottled water where they release these chemicals & may become lethal
attributes.additional_details:
The current filters in the washing machines are not capable enough to filter these microfibers and this leak can be stopped, if we mandate installation of standard microfiber filters

1. The Hidden Plastic In Our Dinner: http://bit.ly/2FeK5YJ 
2. https://www.plymouth.ac.uk/news/washing-clothes-releases-thousands-of-microplastic-particles-into-environment-study-shows
3. https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/28/stella-mccartney-calls-for-overhaul-of-incredibly-wasteful-fashion-industry
4. http://www.thethamesproject.org/dangers-microfibres-microplastics/

attributes.action: Amend the law so Chartered Legal Executives can certify Powers of Attorney
attributes.background: At present we cannot certify General or Lasting Powers of Attorney under existing legislation despite the fact that we can apply to run our own legal practices or be a Judge. It causes confusion for clients and we are having to rely on the goodwill of Solicitor colleagues to assist certifying copies

attributes.action: Urgently provide funding to schools to support children with SEND
attributes.background: We call on the Education Secretary to urgently boost special needs funding as there are currently thousands of children in the UK who have SEND who are without a school place.  This is an unnaceptable situation causing huge stress and anxiety for parents and their children.
attributes.additional_details:
https://schoolsweek.co.uk/hinds-challenged-over-dangerously-inadequate-send-funding/

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/education/education-news/councils-letter-damian-hinds-school-funding-children-special-needs-places-unions-a8403326.html

http://reports.ofsted.gov.uk/index.php?q=filedownloading/&id=2773973&type=1&refer=0

attributes.action: Require DWP assessments for disabled people to take place in hospitals by doctor
attributes.background: DWP assessments should take place in hospitals, not offices, and by doctors, not nurses or other staff. Currently assessments are based on errors, they humiliate people and absolutely no care is shown. Too many people are pushed to appeal.
attributes.additional_details: I’ve been disabled for over 10 years and in my experience, DWP are rude on the phone and there is no care for the individual. I felt humiliated by the assessor who wouldn't even open a door for me. Despite clearly seeing that you’re ill, they try to make you bend, touch your toes, and lean forward which is so humiliating for people. They even look to see if you’ve got nail polish on and whether your clothes are clean. This humiliating process has to stop.

attributes.action: Limit the number of breeding bitches a breeder can be licensed for to 20.
attributes.background: In the UK we are seeing an increasing amount of large scale breeders turning out thousands of puppies. This large scale breeding produces domestic pets that cannot be effectively socialised due to the mass production of puppies, and in turn leads to a high volume of rehoming and abandonment of dogs.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs are domestic pets, they are meant to live in the home as part of the family. Large scale breeders are turning man’s best friend into production stock, a dogs needs to be socialised as a pet cannot take place in such large breeding environments and therefore makes them less able to be domesticated. As a nation, we need to address this and put an end to ‘farming’ of pets, allowing only for small scale breeding where puppies needs can be met appropriately. ‘Twenty is Plenty’ campaign.

attributes.action: Lower the retirement age for frontline road and call takers ambulance staff
attributes.background: 65 is the retirement age for ambulance staff. This type of work is too much at this age. Carrying patients, 12 hour shifts, night shifts and the type of jobs we see. We have a high mortality rate. We need to be brought in line with fire staff and police staff.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that ambulance staff have a mortality rate of 2 years post retirement. At a time when our staff should be relaxing after caring so much for so many years many are being taken from us too early. Reduce the retirement age

attributes.action: Make it illegal for school children to be punished for dinner money arrears
attributes.background:
A recent incident of a school child being excluded and given bread and water instead of a hot meal or full lunch with friends has highlighted treatment which appears "Dickensian" when small arrears build up for school dinners. 

This must stop.
attributes.additional_details:
Children are vulnerable people, who by default cannot consent to or take control of actions revolving around the organisation of their lunch arrangements.

Schools must not be allowed to punish children for what is the responsibility of adults.

There are many legitimate reasons why a payment may be missed or packed lunch misplaced.

Children excluded in this way are liable to long term emotional suffering.

Denying proper food choice is not allowed in prisons. 

It must not be allowed in schools.

attributes.action: Make PSA tests mandatory for all men over 50
attributes.background:
Join Male Cancer charity Balls to Cancer's campaign to get mandatory PSA tests for all men over 50. 
Prostate cancer is the biggest cancer killer for men over 50 in the UK killing 40,000 men annually.
Help us make government make this as important as breast & smear testing
attributes.additional_details: If every man over 50 has a PSA test more cases of prostate cancer could be found and treated early saving many lives.

attributes.action: Get the transport secretary to review the C2C rail contract.
attributes.background: Since Trentalia took over the C2C contract the service has become so bad it is directly affecting customers lives. Frequent train malfunctions, delays and staff on the social media channels lying to the customers about being able to claim delay repay are rendering the service unusable.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the things C2C customers have suffered from of late include:

- Being ejected at stations like Barking or Upminster with no explanation.
- Being lied to that delay repay covers your total journey when the online system ONLY takes into account train time.
- Broken trains on a regular basis.
- Cancelled trains on a regular basis.
- Shortened trains every day since last summer.
- Delays on a weekly basis that do not 'qualify' for a refund.

attributes.action: Abolish changes to free school meals
attributes.background: Recent government changes to the free school meal system will mean millions of vulnerable and less well off children will loose out on their only hot meal of the day

attributes.action: Ask UN to take Jerusalem under its protection.
attributes.background: US recognition of Jerusalem as Israel's capital has emboldened Israel to carry on denying that East Jerusalem is occupied. The only fair solution is to return to the 1947 Partition Plan and make Jerusalem a corpus separatum.

attributes.action: Introduce a health and safety law on the maximum temperature in a workplace
attributes.background: With the current heatwave in the UK employees all over the country are suffering and struggling to continue working. Many institutions lack working air conditioning systems and without a law on the maximum temperatures within workplaces, employers are doing very little to aid the welfare of staff.
attributes.additional_details: In some fast food restaurants, kitchens are reaching highs of 36 degrees Celsius. Staff working in kitchens of all kinds are surrounded by grills, oil fryers, and heated surfaces, and cannot drink within their station for fear of cross contamination. All of these factors combine to make workplaces unbearable, and especially those working around food who sweat profusely in these conditions, it is not just them but the consumers at risk.

attributes.action: Enact a Gaelic Languages Act; equal status for Irish, Scottish Gaelic & Welsh
attributes.background: The Welsh Language Act 1993 recognises that language on a UK-wide basis and status not enjoyed by Irish or Scottish Gaelic. The UK Government agreed to an Irish Act as part of the St Andrew's Agreement 2006. A UK 'Gaelic Languages Act' would be non-sectarian and give Gaelic the same status as Welsh.
attributes.additional_details:
In the UK you can establish a company, pay your taxes and renew your MOT in Welsh. The same should be true of Gaelic.


Welsh Language Act 1993:

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1993/38/contents

St Andrew's Agreement 2006:

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/136651/st_andrews_agreement-2.pdf

Background in English: https://goo.gl/WpYhuW

Faisnéis chúlra i nGaeilge: https://goo.gl/MvU4YP

Cùl-fhiosrachadh ann an Gàidhlig: https://goo.gl/TSkBfd

attributes.action: Make it a fineable offence to cross tidal roads outside of safe crossing times.
attributes.background: Every year dozens of people ignore the safe crossing times at the Holy Island causeway and are rescued by the RNLI. This not only risks lives and uses a service that could be required elsewhere, but also costs the taxpayer tens of thousands of pounds each year which could be avoided.
attributes.additional_details:
Figures from the Ministry of Defence in 2017 show a sea rescue costs approximately £1,900, while an air rescue by the RAF costs more than £4,000.

This petition relates to all tidal roads and causeways in the UK.

We, the undersigned, would like to see drivers who ignore safe crossing times on tidal roads/causeways and require rescue be fined for their actions, and for this money to be invested in the RNLI.

attributes.action: Support the curry industry by reviewing immigration policy
attributes.background: The British curry industry is suffering since the government's cap on skilled workers was introduced over 10 years ago. We urge the government to review and reverse this policy as this cap is creating a vacuum in the area of skilled chefs, damaging growth and sustainability of the industry.
attributes.additional_details:
Previous attempts by this and former governments to train chefs within specialized Training Centres of Excellence in the UK have consistently failed to produce the skilled chefs required to address the shortage. Closures of restaurants around the country are at an alarming rate of 3-4 per week. Heavy handed raids by UKBA and heavily imposed penalties add to the burden levied upon the restaurateurs eager to maintain and survive the current economic climate.
For further info visit www.bca1960.com”
attributes.creator_name: Mohammed Mustafa Kamal Yakub, on behalf of the Bangladesh Caterers Association

attributes.action: Ban the use and production of micro-plastic glitter!
attributes.background:
Micro-plastic glitters are used in everyday items; posing an ecological hazard to our oceans and aquatic life.
There is a ban on micro-beads and we call for this ban to be extended to micro-plastic glitter.
attributes.additional_details:
Micro-plastic glitter passes through waterways into the ocean, marine life and birds mistake it for food; glitters are produced with toxic additives; which is then consumed by us. It has been reported that plastic was found in a third of UK-caught fish. With approx. 51 million fragments in the ocean.

These micro-plastic glitter can break down to release chemicals that disrupt hormones in the bodies of both animals and humans
We hold a responsibility to future generations to stop this pollution.

attributes.action: Set up a public inquiry into Greater Manchester Police.
attributes.background: GMP has been the subject of negative media reports. Complaints have been to the Independent Office for Police Conduct & the Mayor, but there are still problems.
attributes.additional_details: Police forces shouldn’t be able to investigate themselves as GMP has done. That is a failing in the police complaints system, resulting in a lack of accountability for senior police officers. GMP also has primacy over the North-West Counter Terrorism Unit. Any problems in GMP could risk being transferred to the NWCTU, which could potentially have a national impact. We need a public inquiry now.

attributes.action: Stop Network Rail's programme to fell millions of trees
attributes.background: Network Rail recently began cutting down trees on a massive scale. We call on the government to halt this tree felling programme until a comprehensive public consultation has been conducted, to include relevant wildlife and environmental bodies such as The Wildlife Trust, RSPB, The Tree Council, etc
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theguardian.com/business/2018/apr/29/millions-of-trees-at-risk-in-secretive-network-rail-felling-programme

attributes.action: Create a change to the law on home invasions, to further protect residents.
attributes.background: Currently the law only allows for ‘reasonable force’ in protecting ones home from an armed invader. This is too vague. With legitimate fear of injury or death, householders must be protected from prosecution or arrest if such a threat gives rise to an altercation in which a home invader dies.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2012 the Justice Secretary proposed amending the law in England and Wales on self-defence to protect householders who over-react when confronted by a burglar or intruder. 

We want the law to be shifted in favour of the householder to give them certainty that they will not be prosecuted, if a home invader dies during the course of an invasion, when armed with a weapon that can cause servere injury or death. 

We propose a ‘Castle Law’ that will protect victims from prosecution.

attributes.action: Change the law on smashing a car window to release a dog from a hot car.
attributes.background: At present, members of the public risk being prosecuted for criminal damage if they act on instinct and smash the window of a vehicle to release a distressed dog which is trapped inside the vehicle in hot weather. The burden of proof is upon them to show that smashing the window was necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please change the law to allow for concerned members of the public to release animals (dogs) trapped inside vehicles by smashing a window in circumstances where it would be deemed reasonable to assume that the animal (dog) is suffering from heat stroke or is at imminent risk of suffering heatstroke. Place the burden of proof on the owner to demonstrate that the animal (dog) was not at risk.

attributes.action: Start the Gender Reform Act reformation process
attributes.background: The Government announced a consultation in 2016 to reform the Gender Recognition Act. This has been delayed for no explained reason, which has resulted in confusion, fear and misinformation, it’s delayed equality measures for our Trans and non-binary residents.
attributes.additional_details:
The Gender Recognition Act is in urgent need of reform if Her Majesty’s Government is to bring about full legal dignity for its trans and non-binary citizens. When the Women and Equalities Committee set out its recommendations for trans equality in 2016, it called to "update the GRA in line with principles of gender self-declaration [through statutory declaration] that have been developed in other jurisdictions", in turn removing the
medicalised, quasi-judicial process for gender recognition.

attributes.action: change the law for people who commit animal cruelty to be sentenced  up to 5yrs
attributes.background: Social media is rife everyday with animal abuse stories, videos or photos. The sentences are not tough enough and do not act as any deterrent.  Also there is nothing in place to make sure offenders do not re-offend.  I want the gov to change the law to a max of 5 yrs by the end of this year.
attributes.additional_details: My prev petition was not clear enough.  The government has announced plans to increase the max sentence to 5 years but i would like to see this happening by the end of this year at the latest.

attributes.action: Ban the shooting of Pheasants, Partridges and Grouse for sport.
attributes.background: 35 Million "game birds" are placed into the countryside annually for shooting, disrupting the environmental balance.  Native wildlife is killed to increase the number of game birds available for shooting. Damage to the environment and suffering to native species and to the game birds is unacceptable
attributes.additional_details: The the introduction of a tens millions of non-native birds upsets the environmental balance of our countryside increasing competition, especially for food amongst native birds. Wildlife such as foxes, crows, magpies, badgers and weasels are directly or indirectly affected by shooting, snaring, trapping and illegal poisoning carried out by gamekeepers. Additionally, the loss of predator species does in itself further disrupt the local wildlife balance as species such as rodents can then thrive.

attributes.action: Fund the dualling of the A120 from Hare Green to Harwich
attributes.background: There is an agreement in place for the stretch of the A120 to be dualled with funding from Hutchison Ports as part of planning permission for a container port at Bathside Bay, Harwich. But this has been delayed for years and the town cannot wait any longer - the road needs to be dualled now.
attributes.additional_details: With an ever increasing population and more lorries using Harwich International Port the road is under strain. It is also in need of complete relaying as the concrete slabs it was laid on are at the end of their lifespan. The road should be dualled now rather than relaying it as a single carriageway. Better road access is hoped to bring economic growth to Tendring, which has some of the most deprived wards in the country. It is also home to a major UK port - a gateway to Europe.

attributes.action: Introduce state registry system for medical cannabis cards in the UK
attributes.background: A system already stablished in several countries that allows the possession of cannabis by people suffering from a chronic or debilitating disease or condition which has been diagnosed by a licensed physician who believes the use of cannabis will benefit the patient's condition and well-being.
attributes.additional_details:
Amend current legislation and introduce a system similar to the one existing in Colorado (USA), where registered patients can obtain a valid ID which allows them to possess no more than two Oz of a usable form of the plant and to grow for personal use no more than 6 plants (maximum of 3 being mature plants) at a time.

A new report about the effects of cannabis is needed reflecting all the new evidence supporting its beneficial effects as well as solutions to the so called "harmful effects".
